iiv.display

Class ComponentGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • iiv.display.ComponentGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LocationMapping, Croppable, Zoomable, CNUFileObject, iiVScriptable, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class ComponentGroup
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements CNUFileObject, iiVScriptable, Croppable, LocationMapping, Zoomable
    Container to treat a group of components as one.
    Since:
    iiV1.0
    See Also:
    CNUViewer, Container, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComponentGroup

        public ComponentGroup(java.awt.Component[] components,
                      java.awt.Point[] locations)
        Constructs a new instance of ComponentGroup with given components and locations in array lists. To minimize the group size locations are translated setting the minimum x and y location to (0,0) while maintaining relative locations. The inverse amount of the translation may be queried with the method getLocation() right after creating the group and before adding to a container. This amount can be used to set the groups location to maintain the components position relative to an original container.
        Parameters:
        components - components this group will contain
        locations - corresponding location for each component within the group.

      • ComponentGroup

        public ComponentGroup(java.awt.Component[] components,
                      java.awt.Point[] locations,
                      java.awt.Rectangle region)
        Constructs a new instance of ComponentGroup with given components and locations in array lists. To minimize the group size locations are translated by the region origin maintaining relative locations. The inverse amount of the translation may be queried with the method getLocation() right after creating the group and before adding to a container. This amount can be used to set the groups location to maintain the components position relative to an original container.
        Parameters:
        components - components this group will contain
        locations - corresponding location for each component within the group.
        region - region that dictates the origin and size of the group relative to locations. If null origin will be set to minimum x and y location and size set to include all components.

      • ComponentGroup

        public ComponentGroup(java.util.Vector vComponents,
                      java.util.Vector vLocations)
        Constructs a new instance of ComponentGroup with given components and locations in vector lists. Vectors are copied to arrays for internal usage. To minimize the group size locations are translated setting the minimum x and y location to (0,0) while maintaining relative locations. The inverse amount of the translateion may be queried with the method getLocation() right after creation and before adding to a container. This amount can be used to set the groups location to maintain the components position relative to an original container.
        Parameters:
        vComponents - vector of components this group will contain
        vLocations - vector of corresponding locations for each component within the group.

      • ComponentGroup

        public ComponentGroup(java.util.Vector vComponents,
                      java.util.Vector vLocations,
                      java.awt.Rectangle region)
        Constructs a new instance of ComponentGroup with given components and locations in vector lists. Vectors are copied to arrays for internal usage. To minimize the group size locations are translated by the region origin maintaining relative locations. The inverse amount of the translation may be queried with the method getLocation() right after creation and before adding to a container. This amount can be used to set the groups location to maintain the components position relative to an original container.
        Parameters:
        vComponents - vector of components this group will contain
        vLocations - vector of corresponding locations for each component within the group.
        region - region that dictates the origin and size of the group relative to locations. If null origin will be set to minimum x and y location and size set to include all components.

    • Method Detail

      • doLayout

        public void doLayout()
        Layout this container without calling a layout manager. This group may have been ungrouped (all components added back to main container which auto-majicly removes them from this container) in which case it may contain no components but the fact that doLayout is called means we want the components back in this container so re-add them if any are missing.
        Overrides:
        doLayout in class java.awt.Container

        Parameters:

      • setSubcomponentOriginalZoom

        public void setSubcomponentOriginalZoom(int compNum,
                                        double zoomV,
                                        double zoomH)
        Sets the original zooms for a subcomponent. Only for correcting scripted components original zoom. While older iiV versions will fail when this method is called from a script they will still display the subcomponent scaled correctly.
        Parameters:
        compNum - component number
        zoomV - vertical zoom
        zoomH - horizontal zoom
